metadata.Title: CVE-2017-10662 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The sanity_check_raw_super function in fs/f2fs/super.c in the Linux kernel before 4.11.1 does not validate the segment count, which allows local users to gain privileges via unspecified vectors. It was discovered that the Flash-Friendly File System (f2fs) implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly validate superblock metadata. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-10662` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-83-generic - 4.4.0-83.106
linux-image-4.4.0-83-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-83.106
linux-image-4.4.0-83-lowlatency - 4.4.0-83.106
linux-image-4.4.0-83-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-83.106

linux-image-4.4.0-83-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-83.106
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-83-generic - 4.4.0-83.106
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-83.106').

linux-azure package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.0-1009.9').
